20234.「おおっ これが ナゴミオイルか。\n ありがとう <pc>君！:
Woah, you managed to bring the Relaxation
Oil. Thanks a lot, <pc>!

20235.「よし。あとは 父上が用意してくれた材料と\n 混ぜ合わせれば 薬が できるはず:
All right. All that's left is to mix it with
the materials provided by my father, and the
potion should be ready.

20236.「父上！ オチツキ草をお願いします。: Father! Bring the Calmness Herb, please.

20237.「うむ。ちゃんと用意してあるぞ。\n いやあ 苦労したのだよ。\n 城の衛士を:
Certainly, it's all prepared and ready. You
see, I went through quite an ordeal, having
to mobilize about 20 of the castle guards...

20240.「あの……その～ なんだ……。\n 必要なのは オチツキ草……だったか？:
Well... you see... The item we needed
was a bit of Calmness Herb... right?

20242.「ワ…ワシが 苦労して用意したのは……\n モ…モチツキ草……だった……。:
I... I worked so hard to prepare...
a S-Somnus Herb...

20244.「わはっ……わははは。安心しろ。\n オチツキ草なら たしか この城にも\n い:
W... Wah-hahaha. But worry not! If the
Calmness Herb is the one you need, I'm sure
we will find some in the castle's storage!

20247.「……父上が そのように いいかげんだから\n 男が 王位に就くべきではないなど:
...Given how Father behaves, it's natural
to have discussions about whether someone
like him should be on the throne.

20249.「……僕は オチツキ草を取りにいって\n 同調のための薬を 作ってきます。\n:
...I'll go and get more Calmness Herb, then I'll prepare the synchronization medicine. Mother, please make sure everything is ready
to chant the Song of Grace.

20250.「わかった。バルコニーに行くとしよう。\n 城下の民にも 結果を見定めてもらうの:
Certainly. We shall convene on the balcony
once you are prepared. I shall ensure that the
townspeople bear witness this event's outcome.

20251.「よろしくお願いします 母上。\n 僕も薬を作ったら すぐに向かいます。:
Thank you, Mother. I will be there as
soon as I have the medicine ready.

20252.「君にも ぜひ 立ち会ってもらいたいんだ。\n 城のバルコニーまで 来てほしい。:
I'd like you to be there too.
Come to the castle balcony.

20253.「<pc>君 待たせたな。\n 君が用意してくれた ナゴミオイルのおかげで\n:
Sorry to keep you waiting, . Thanks to the Relaxation Oil you brought, the medicine to synchronize with my Mother's
heart has been completed.

20254.「薬を飲んで とても 落ち着いた気分だ。\n これで 恵みの歌の効果を生みだせる:
I feel very calm after taking the pills. This
will create the effect of a song of grace.
Now, go ahead and take your reward first.

20255.「よし。では 恵みの歌を唄おう！！: All right. Then let us sing a song of grace!

20256.「母上。王家のチカラを 僕に……。: Mother. I have the power of royalty...

20257.「オーディス。わらわは\n お前なら できると信じているぞ。: Odis. I believe you can do it.

20258.<center>……海に生まれ 海に生きる。\nそれが我ら ウェディの民。:
...Born to the sea and live by the sea. We are
the people of Weddie.

20259.<center>母なる海に祈りを捧げ\n我らは求める 神の恵みを。:
Praying to the Mother Sea, we ask for God's
grace.

20260.<center>大いなる海の神よ。\n我らの命 我らの思い\n守りたまえ 清めた:
Great God of the sea. Protect our lives, our
thoughts, and purify...

20262.「……そんなはずはない。\n オーディスには 王の資格があると\n わらわは 感:
That can't be true. I have a feeling Odis is
fit to be king.

20263.「歌のチカラが まったく発揮されないなど\n ありえないことだ……。:
It's impossible for a song to have no power at
all...

20264.「僕の努力が まだ足りないというのか……。:
I don't know if it's because I'm not trying
hard enough...

20265.「……その恵みの歌は\n 男性が唄っても 効果が出ないのです。:
...that song of grace is not effective when
sung by men.

20266.「セーリア……。\n 君は 何か知っているのか？: Celia... do you know anything about this?

20267.「これは……私の父 ラーディスより\n 後世に伝えることを 禁じられた話です。:
This is a story my father, Ladis, forbade me
to tell to future generations.

20268.「ですが 王子は 私を救ってくれた恩人。\n このまま だまっていては\n その:
But the prince is the one who saved me. If I
don't do something about it, I'll have to
repay him in kind...

20269.「なんと……。そなたの父は\n 最後の男王 ラーディス王であったか。:
My God... your father was the last male King
Ladis.

20270.「はい……。隠していたわけでは ありませんが\n 王子を前にして 言いだせなくて:
Yes, I wasn't hiding it, but I couldn't say it
in front of the prince.

20271.「そんなことは 気にしなくてもいい。\n 男が唄っても 効果がないと言ったね？\:
Don't worry about that. You said it doesn't
work when a man sings? I want you to tell me
what you mean.

20272.「遠い昔……。\n 諸島を囲む海に 聖なる加護を与える歌は\n 育みの歌と呼ばれ:
Long ago, there was a song that gave sacred
blessings to the seas surrounding the islands,
a song called the "nurturing song.

20273.「ですが 長い歴史の中で\n 育みの歌は 歌の効果を高めるため\n ふたつの歌に:
But over its long history, the nurturing songs
were divided into two types of songs in order
to enhance the effectiveness of the songs.

20274.「恵みの歌は そのひとつ。\n 女王が唄うために作られた 歌なのです。:
The Song of Grace is one of them. It was
written for the queen to sing.

20275.「女王が唄うため……？ ということは\n 男王のための歌も 存在するというのか？:
For queens to sing...? Does that mean there
are songs for male kings? But no such song was
ever handed down to the royal family...

20276.「男王の歌は ラーディス王が\n 王位を退く際に その手で封印しました。:
The Song of the Man-King was sealed in his
hand when King Ladis abdicated his throne.

20277.「……なるほど。ラーディス王以降に\n 女王が国を治める時代となったのも\n そ:
I see. That is why queens ruled the country
after King Ladis....

20278.「男王の歌が どこに封印されたのか\n 君は 知っているのか？:
Do you know where the Song of the Man King was
sealed?

20279.「ごめんなさい……。\n それは 私にも わからないのです。: I'm sorry...I don't know that either.

20280.「いや。あやまらないでくれ。\n 君が悪いわけじゃない。: Nope. Don't be sorry. It's not your fault.

20281.「……ありがとう セーリア。\n 君は 僕のために 父上との約束を破って\n こ:
Thank you, Celia. You broke your promise to
your father to tell me all this for my sake.

20282.「君のおかげで 王になるために\n 僕が やるべきことが わかった。\n 封印さ:
Thanks to you, I know what I must do to become
king. I'll find the song that's been sealed
away!

20283.「もしかしたら 君のチカラを\n 借りることに なるかもしれない。\n そのとき:
I may need your help. If so, please do me a
favor <pc>.

20284.「セーリア！ くわしい話を聞かせてほしい。\n 一緒に来てくれるかい？:
Celia! I'd like to hear more about what you
have to say. Will you come with me?

20286.「どうやら オーディスが 王となるためには\n まだ 越えねばならぬカベが ある:
Apparently, Odis still has a few more hurdles
to cross before he can become king.

20287.「今後も オーディスが そなたを\n 必要としたときは 手を貸してやってくれ。\:
In the future, when Odis needs you, please
lend a hand. I ask this as a queen... or
rather, as a mother.
